intro: Berinia nicaeensis, commonly known as the Corsican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Corsica. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Berinia nicaeensis is known for its ornamental value and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native range.
